question: 呼ぶ
sourceAnswer: to{} call-out-(to)/call/invoke | summon-(a-doctor,-etc.) | invite | designate/name/brand | garner-(support,-etc.)/gather | take-as-one's-wife
sourceMnemonic: Because the hiragana ends with an <ja>う</ja> sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>call</kanji> so the verb vocab version is <vocabulary>to call</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>to call out</vocabulary>. As in "HEY, YOU!"
sourceReadingMnemonic: The reading is the same as the kanji, so you should be good here. Just imagine yourself  calling out to someone: "<reading>YO</reading> (<ja>よ</ja>)! You!"
